abstracts.cdata!:
Ratings for the Administrative Capacity
            Building Project for Burkina Faso were as follows: outcomes
            were moderately satisfactory; risk to development outcome
            was medium/moderate; Bank performance was moderately
            satisfactory and borrower performance was also moderately
            satisfactory. Some lessons learned includes: excessive
            optimism in decentralization and de- concentration
            commitment. Focusing on studies, training and Information
            Technology (IT) equipment in a context of serious budget
            constraint means that some studies recommendations will not
            be implemented. A demand-driven project is not a panacea for
            a good design. Public sector reform requires flexibility,
            which can be resource-consuming in the context of a grant.
            Civil servant training and IT equipment do not necessarily
            lead to civil servant behavioral change. Lack of impact
            evaluation for cross-cutting public sector reforms, such as
            decentralization and de-concentration, hampers impact improvement.
